title: ZincSolar is the first PV company worldwide with a net-zero target approved by the Science-Based Targets Initiative - Business News
text: SHANGRAO, China, Dec. 28, 2023 /PRNewswire/ — ZincSolar Holding Co., Ltd. (“ZinkSolar” or the “Company”) (NYSE: JKS), one of the world's largest and most innovative solar module manufacturers, today announced that The near- and long-term science-based emission reduction targets* of its key subsidiary Jinko Solar Co., Ltd. have recently been approved by SBTI, making JinkoSolar the world's first PV company to have its own net. -Zero target valid. It is only the second company in mainland China to achieve this status, as well as the third company in the global semi-conductor industry. The Science-Based Targets Initiative (SBTI) is a global body that enables businesses to set ambitious emissions reduction targets in line with the latest climate science. Its focus is on accelerating companies around the world to halve emissions before 2030 and achieve net-zero emissions before 2050. In the era of global warming, participating in and setting science-based targets has become a new business norm, reflecting competitiveness and responsibility. of companies in the field of sustainable development and ESG. Currently, more than 7,000 companies worldwide have committed to SBTI, including Tesla, Apple, BASF, Lenovo, and Tencent. In late 2019, JinkoSolar announced its participation in the RE100 green initiative and in late 2021, Jinko Solar Co., Ltd. officially committed to set a net-zero target in line with SBTI with climate science. In the first half of 2023, Jinko Solar Co., Ltd. released its 2022 ESG report, outlining its climate roadmap for the first time. Leveraging its continuously innovative PV technology and reliable PV products, JinkoSolar provides clean, safe, affordable and renewable electricity globally. It addresses global climate change with an economic, green and viable approach. In the fourth quarter of 2023, JinkoSolar became the first PV company to deliver a total of more than 200 GW of solar modules. Accordingly, IHS Markit estimates that one in every eight modules in the world today was manufactured by ZincSolar, contributing to 1 kilogram of carbon reduction for every 8 kilograms of PV products. By working with SBTI and setting net-zero targets, ZincSolar is not only declaring its ambition to address climate change, but also providing a clear action guide for full value chain emissions reduction. JinkoSolar is fully committed to playing its part in the global energy transition and contributing to building a greener and more sustainable future. *SBTI plans to publish the approved net-zero target of Jinko Solar Company Limited on its website on 25 January 2024. About JinkoSolar Holding Company Limited JinkoSolar (NYSE: JKS) is one of the world's largest and most innovative solar module manufacturers. JinkoSolar distributes its solar products and offers its solutions to a diverse international utility, commercial and residential customer base in China, United States of America, Japan, Germany, United Kingdom, Chile, South Africa, India, Mexico, Brazil, United States and Sells services. Arab Emirates, Italy, Spain, France, Belgium, Netherlands, Poland, Austria, Switzerland, Greece and other countries and regions. ZincSolar has 14 production facilities globally, 24 overseas in Japan, South Korea, Vietnam, India, Turkey, Germany, Italy, Switzerland, United States, Mexico, Brazil, Chile, Australia, Canada, Malaysia, United Arab Emirates, Denmark There are subsidiary companies. , Indonesia, Nigeria and Saudi Arabia, and global sales teams in China, United States, Canada, Brazil, Chile, Mexico, Italy, Germany, Turkey, Spain, Japan, United Arab Emirates, Netherlands, Vietnam and India. 30 September 2023.
